Use a tree‐based approach for advanced text formatting (#1907)

* Use a tree‐based approach for adv. text formatting

Sanitizing HTML/Markdown means parsing the content into an HTML tree
under‐the‐hood anyway, and it is more accurate to do mention/hashtag
replacement on the text nodes in that tree than it is to try to hack it
in with regexes et cetera.

This undoes the overrides of `#entities` and `#rewrite` on
`AdvancedTextFormatter` but also stops using them, instead keeping
track of the parsed Nokogiri tree itself and using that in the `#to_s`
method.

Internally, this tree uses `<mastodon-entity>` nodes to keep track of
hashtags, links, and mentions. Sanitization is moved to the beginning,
so it should be known that these do not appear in the input.

* Also disallow entities inside of `<code>`

I think this is generally expected behaviour, and people are annoyed
when their code gets turned into links/hashtags/mentions.

* Minor cleanup to AdvancedTextFormatter

* Change AdvancedTextFormatter to rewrite entities in one pass and sanitize at the end

Also, minor refactoring to better match how other formatters are organized.

* Add some tests

Co-authored-by: Claire <claire.github-309c@sitedethib.com>

issue.title: `tootctl domains purge` does not include subdomains, while instance blocks do
issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Run `tootctl domains purge`, eg on the recent spam domain activitypub-troll.cf 
2. Observe that no subdomains are purged.
...


### Expected behaviour

Domain blocks extend to subdomains, so purges should, too (or at least have an option to disable that mode)

### Actual behaviour

Subdomains do not get purged.

### Detailed description

Only the exact match is purged. In the case of the recent spam domain, this sucks – we have over 1k individual 1 user spam domains lying around now, and no real way to get rid of them.

### Specifications

Mastodon 4.0.2

comment.body: This should be an explicit flag, though, both in the admin UI (maybe a checkbox) and on the CLI. You usually only want to purge the apex domain (old entries of instances that have moved to a new subdomain, etc.).

issue.title: LinkCrawlWorker: AddressFamilyError
issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Fetch https://mastodon.social/@georgrestle/109320263671765094, or have it otherwise try to crawl the URL http://www.sichtbar-machen.online/ linked in that post
2. Look at sidekiq retries/deads
...


### Expected behaviour

The link should be fetched fine

### Actual behaviour

IPAddr::AddressFamilyError: address family must be specified on http://www.sichtbar-machen.online/

### Detailed description

_No response_

### Specifications

4.0.2

issue.title: Allow for showing of more than 4 images from other instances
issue.body:
### Pitch

Allow posts that have more than 4 images to be shown.

I think I good way of showing this in the UI would be to have the images scroll horizontally. Something like this, but with an arrow button to scroll
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40742947/204240870-08e11f0d-7b4c-4b8e-aa20-40ae3f3df4f1.png)


### Motivation

For example, Pixelfed (and some other platforms) lets users add more than 4 images. But people on Mastodon will only see the first 4, creating a disconnect.

(issue copied from https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/issues/19454)

comment.body:
This is currently on my bucket list as a configurable instance wide limit.

The ruby code for this requires not a lot of modification. However, the UI does, since you need to both tell a user "there's more than four images here" and a way to actually view thumbnails for all of them (the "fullscreen" view would not be an issue, as that requires little to no changes as far as I know).

issue.title: Allow users to self-impose a shorter character limit than the server maximum
issue.body:
### Pitch

It would be nice if users could opt in to a lower character limit for their posts than the server’s character limit.

I’m imagining a numerical text-entry field in the App Settings that allows any character limit between 1 (for lack of a less arbitrary lower limit) and the server’s character limit.

### Motivation

The Mastodon default character limit is 500, but with the Glitch edition this can be higher—the server I use allows posts of up to 2,500 characters. Some users would prefer to be held to a lower limit, for one of these reasons:

1. Constraint can lead to creativity (for some people, in some situations!). 280- or 500-character limits force brevity in a way that a 2,500-character limit does not, and some people appreciate writing under such a constraint.

2. Interoperability concerns. The Glitch edition will collapse longer posts, for example, and users may prefer to write shorter posts if this means a lower chance of them being collapsed by other users’ clients.

    There may also be Mastodon clients out there that assume that posts are ≤500 characters. This is just speculative, though.

### Alternatives

Long limits would be less of an issue if the posting UI showed how many characters the user has already typed. Right now it shows how many characters they have left. This is definitely the right UI for most people, but if you’re trying to stick to a limit lower than the server’s limit, you have to do mental math as you’re composing each post.

Another approach to implementing what I’m asking for would be to optionally display a count *up* instead of a count *down*. The disadvantage with doing it this way is that the change would only apply to the web UI; other clients would need to make their own changes. Changing the character limit per-user would presumably be easier to convey to third-party clients, which are already aware that they need to handle different character limits across different servers.

comment.body: I think simply displaying both counts (`current/max` format) would help a lot already (both in the web UI and third-party clients), in addition to this.

issue.title: Option: Hide unlisted posts from user's profile page
issue.body:
### Pitch

This feature suggestion involves either introducing another post privacy level, or a setting that would change how the "Unlisted" privacy level works.

The suggested privacy level, "Hidden", would work the same way as "Unlisted", except the statuses posted under it would also not be shown in the poster's profile page (when seen by non-followers or unauthenticated users).

Alternatively, this could be a setting in the user's preferences, that, when enabled, will hide all "Unlisted" posts from the user's profile page (when seen by non-followers or unauthenticated users).

Functionally, I would expect the end result to be similar to the "Followers only" setting, except the ability to boost the post or to visit it via URL would remain.

### Motivation

I feel that the difference between the privacy levels of "Unlisted" (not shown in the local/fed timelines) and "Followers only" (unboostable, can't be found via URL) is too wide, and there needs to be a setting in between of the two.

comment.body:
My idea for this would be to implement a user-level option to do what GoToSocial currently does: To prevent showing any unlisted posts to non-followers on the unauthenticated API.

This might not be exactly what @slashdevslashurandom wants, since non-followers (but ActivityPub users) will still see the posts if they're on another instance and the posts federate there, and we have no way to actually stop that, but it would be an improvement.

issue.title: Add Support for Emoji Reactions
issue.body:
I'm running a custom fork of glitch-soc on my instance and recently implemented Akkoma-style emoji reactions for it.  It has been running without issues so far, so I'm offering to merge the code with upstream because I believe it's quite a cool feature (and it would also make my diffs smaller :3).

Some details of how this works:

- Each user can add up to eight reactions to a single toot (this is a default value and can be customized through the `MAX_REACTIONS` environment variable)
- The toot author receives a notification for every reaction, although it's possible to filter them just like all other notification categories
- Reactions federate to and from other compatible servers (tested with Akkoma and Misskey); this works through an ActivityPub extension as seen on Akkoma

The whole thing is based on announcement reactions, and I also took some architectural hints from the [Fedibird fork](https://github.com/fedibird/mastodon/commit/95e23def5614855088647f841a2c2f2938dec209).

I'm sorry if this description lacks some important details; I don't really do pull requests very often and never have for such a large commit.  Feel free to ask for clarification.

comment.body: Misskey makes the same assumption, I think. I've seen some Misskey instances show the emoji shortcode in the reaction button.

issue.body:
<!-- Hi! Thanks for filing an issue. It will be read with care by human beings. Can we ask you to please fill out this template and not simply demand new features or send in complaints? Thanks! -->
<!-- Also please search the existing issues (both open and closed) to see if your report might be duplicate -->

<!-- Tell us what is issue is about -->
 - Program: dnsdist <!-- delete the ones that do not apply -->
 - Issue type: Feature request

### Short description
<!-- Explain in a few sentences what the issue/request is -->
A rule that checks whether an incoming query has a TSIG attached (no checks for validity). If it's attached, the rule matches. Otherwise, it doesn't.

### Usecase
<!-- Tell what you're trying to achieve, without describing _what_ the requested feature should do -->
- Forwarding any queries with a TSIG signature to a specific server
- Disabling ECS on matching queries (they conflict with TSIG)

issue.title: auth, dnsdist: TSIG, ECS conflict, causing auth REFUSED
issue.body:
<!-- Hi! Thanks for filing an issue. It will be read with care by human beings. Can we ask you to please fill out this template and not simply demand new features or send in complaints? Thanks! -->
<!-- Also please search the existing issues (both open and closed) to see if your report might be duplicate -->
<!-- Please don't file an issue when you have a support question, send support questions to the mailinglist or ask them on IRC (https://www.powerdns.com/opensource.html) -->
<!-- Before filing your ticket, please read our 'out in the open' support policy at https://blog.powerdns.com/2016/01/18/open-source-support-out-in-the-open/ -->

<!-- Tell us what is issue is about -->
 - Program: Authoritative, dnsdist <!-- delete the ones that do not apply -->
 - Issue type: Bug report

### Short description
<!-- Explain in a few sentences what the issue/request is -->
My setup involves PowerDNS Authoritative Server behind dnsdist, also using the Proxy Protocol.
When an incoming query is signed with TSIG, which is required for RFC2136 updates for Let's Encrypt, and ECS is set by dnsdist from either client information or forwarded by an upstream resolver, the response is refused with rcode `REFUSED` (5).

### Environment
<!-- Tell us about the environment -->
 - Operating system: Arch Linux
 - Software version: PowerDNS Authoritative Server 4.7.2, dnsdist 1.7.2
 - Software source: Arch repositories, AUR <!-- e.g. Operating system repository, PowerDNS repository, compiled yourself -->

### Steps to reproduce
<!-- Tell us step-by-step how the issue can be triggered. Please include your configuration files and any (Lua) scripts that are loaded. -->
1. Enable proxy protocol, accept forwarded ECS by dnsdist in Authoritative server, enable proxy protocol for same downstream server, forward ECS in dnsdist <!-- step 1 -->
2. Set TSIGs that are allowed to update certain dns records (with a custom lua policy) <!-- step 2 -->
3. Try to query the SOA record on the domain you're trying to update [as done here](https://github.com/certbot/certbot/blob/3d0c2abd3b3139f1fc0b35c36c8887a24204f87a/certbot-dns-rfc2136/certbot_dns_rfc2136/_internal/dns_rfc2136.py#L224), or try sending an RFC2136 update, with a TSIG signature  <!-- step 3 -->

### Expected behaviour
<!-- What would you expect to happen when the reproduction steps are run -->
I would expect the SOA record to be returned, or the update to be successful.

### Actual behaviour
<!-- What did happen? Please (if possible) provide logs, output from `dig` and/or tcpdump/wireshark data -->
Response refused with rcode `REFUSED` coming from the authoritative server.

### Other information
<!-- if you already did more digging into the issue, please provide all the information you gathered -->
Disabling ECS for queries affected by this fixes this. I am currently working around this precise issue by having the following in my dnsdist config:

```
addAction(OrRule({OpcodeRule(DNSOpcode.Update), QTypeRule(DNSQType.SOA)}), SetDisableECSAction())
```

~~I am unsure if the proxy protocol interacts with this at all – I haven't been able to test that.~~

comment.body:
Interesting, I did try to set this up before but the proxy protocol just wouldn't set the client subnet. This seems to have changed – I don't know when exactly that behaviour would've changed, but I'll take it. I guess that makes this issue no longer affect me, so, thanks, @rgacogne @hlindqvist!

I will close this issue to instead make a feature request for a `TsigRule()` / `TSIGRule()` in dnsdist. This is not an issue in auth, but with the way ECS and TSIG work and thus conflict.

comment.body: @Habbie the purpose of ECS is to have the authoritative server do GeoIP lookups and respond with different record based on the result of these. The purpose of the proxy protocol is to check the incoming resolver IP against a list of resolvers that are allowed to receive certain records (debugging)

issue.title: Add Support for Emoji Reactions
issue.body:
I'm running a custom fork of glitch-soc on my instance and recently implemented Akkoma-style emoji reactions for it.  It has been running without issues so far, so I'm offering to merge the code with upstream because I believe it's quite a cool feature (and it would also make my diffs smaller :3).

Some details of how this works:

- Each user can add up to eight reactions to a single toot (this is a default value and can be customized through the `MAX_REACTIONS` environment variable)
- The toot author receives a notification for every reaction, although it's possible to filter them just like all other notification categories
- Reactions federate to and from other compatible servers (tested with Akkoma and Misskey); this works through an ActivityPub extension as seen on Akkoma

The whole thing is based on announcement reactions, and I also took some architectural hints from the [Fedibird fork](https://github.com/fedibird/mastodon/commit/95e23def5614855088647f841a2c2f2938dec209).

I'm sorry if this description lacks some important details; I don't really do pull requests very often and never have for such a large commit.  Feel free to ask for clarification.

comment.body:
There are two things for me that should probably still get into this PR.

The first is adding the reactions config to the instance presenter (`api/v{1,2}/instance`). I've made a pull request on the fork that does this rather simple change.

The second is that some instance admins probably would like a way to disable reactions entirely via `MAX_REACTIONS=<any value less than 1>`. That should clamp the value to a minimum of 0 instead of the current one. Of course, that would involve making sure that this hides all things related to reactions in the UI as well.

comment.body:
@easrng tbh, I agree that the key in the list of reactions could be called emoji_reactions.

However, I think the rest is really out of place on something that is not Pleroma or, unfortunately, Akkoma, and the API of reactions was designed with the rest of the existing Mastodon API in mind (see also c8ab12a14a76ac0b73134d8ce39a17a899501b07).

issue.title: Add Support for Emoji Reactions
issue.body:
I'm running a custom fork of glitch-soc on my instance and recently implemented Akkoma-style emoji reactions for it.  It has been running without issues so far, so I'm offering to merge the code with upstream because I believe it's quite a cool feature (and it would also make my diffs smaller :3).

Some details of how this works:

- Each user can add up to eight reactions to a single toot (this is a default value and can be customized through the `MAX_REACTIONS` environment variable)
- The toot author receives a notification for every reaction, although it's possible to filter them just like all other notification categories
- Reactions federate to and from other compatible servers (tested with Akkoma and Misskey); this works through an ActivityPub extension as seen on Akkoma

The whole thing is based on announcement reactions, and I also took some architectural hints from the [Fedibird fork](https://github.com/fedibird/mastodon/commit/95e23def5614855088647f841a2c2f2938dec209).

I'm sorry if this description lacks some important details; I don't really do pull requests very often and never have for such a large commit.  Feel free to ask for clarification.

comment.body: @fef1312 Regarding the CircleCI build, try doing a git rebase with your PR branch with glitch-soc:main. 1122697b375da82cbb156b73eb1015ae066fc6ee should fix this.

Helm: Major refactoring regarding Deployments, Environment variables and more (#20733)

* fix(chart): Remove non-functional Horizontal Pod Autoscaler

The Horizontal Pod Autoscaler (HPA) refers to a Deployment that
doesn't exist and therefore can not work. As a result it's
pointless to carry it around in this chart and give the wrong
impression it could work. This patch removes it from the helm
chart and drops all references to it.

* refactor(chart): Refactor sidekiq deployments to scale

This patch reworks how the sidekiq deployment is set up, by
splitting it into many sidekiq deployments, but at least one,
which should allow to scale the number of sidekiq jobs as
expected while being friendly to single user instances as well
as larger ones.

Further it introduces per deployment overwrites for the most
relevant pod fields like resources, affinities and processed
queues, number of jobs and the sidekiq security contexts.

The exact implementation was inspired by an upstream issue:

https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/issues/20453

* fix(chart): Remove linode default values from values

This patch drops the linode defaults from the values.yaml since
these are not obvious and can cause unexpected connections as
well as leaking secrets to linode, when other s3 storage
backends are used and don't explicitly configure these options
by accident.

Mastodon will then try to authenticate to the linode backends
and therefore disclose the authentication secrets.

* refactor(chart): Rework reduce value reference duplication

Since most of the values are simply setup like this:

```
{{- if .Values.someVariable }}
SOME_VARIABLE: {{ .Values.someVariable }}
{{- end }}
```

There is a lot of duplication in the references in order to
full in the variables. There is an equivalent notation, which
reduces the usage of the variable name to just once:

```
{{- with .Values.someVariable }}
SOME_VARIABLE: {{ . }}
{{- end }}
```

What seems like a pointless replacement, will reduce potential
mistakes down the line by possibly only adjusting one of the
two references.

* fix(chart): Switch to new OMNIAUTH_ONLY variable

This patch adjusts the helm chart to use the new `OMNIAUTH_ONLY`
variable, which replaced the former
`OAUTH_REDIRECT_AT_SIGN_IN` variable in the following commit:

https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/17288
https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/17288/commits/3c8857917ea9b9b3a76adb7afcea5842c8e1c0d1

* fix(chart): Repair connection test to existing service

Currently the connect test can't work, since it's connecting to
a non-existing service this patch fixes the service name to
make the job connect to the mastodon web service to verify the
connection.

* docs(chart): Adjust values.yaml to support helm-docs

This patch updates most values to prepare an introduction of
helm-docs. This should help to make the chart more user
friendly by explaining the variables and provide a standardised
README file, like many other helm charts do.

References:
https://github.com/norwoodj/helm-docs

* refactor(chart): Allow individual overwrites for streaming and web deployment

This patch works how the streaming and web deployments work by
adding various fields to overwrite values such as affinities,
resources, replica count, and security contexts.

BREAKING CHANGE: This commit removes `.Values.replicaCount` in
favour of `.Values.mastodon.web.replicas` and
`.Values.mastodon.streaming.values`.

* feat(chart): Add option for authorized fetch

Currently the helm chart doesn't support authorized fetch aka.
"Secure Mode" this patch fixes that by adding the needed config
option to the values file and the configmap.

* docs(chart): Improve helm-docs compatiblity

This patch adjust a few more comments in the values.yaml to be
picked up by helm-docs. This way, future adoption is properly
prepared.

* fix(chart): Add automatic detection of scheduler sidekiq queue

This patch adds an automatic switch to the `Recreate` strategy
for the sidekiq Pod in order to prevent accidental concurrency
for the scheduler queue.

* fix(chart): Repair broken DB_POOL variable

Helm: Major refactoring regarding Deployments, Environment variables and more (#20733)

* fix(chart): Remove non-functional Horizontal Pod Autoscaler

The Horizontal Pod Autoscaler (HPA) refers to a Deployment that
doesn't exist and therefore can not work. As a result it's
pointless to carry it around in this chart and give the wrong
impression it could work. This patch removes it from the helm
chart and drops all references to it.

* refactor(chart): Refactor sidekiq deployments to scale

This patch reworks how the sidekiq deployment is set up, by
splitting it into many sidekiq deployments, but at least one,
which should allow to scale the number of sidekiq jobs as
expected while being friendly to single user instances as well
as larger ones.

Further it introduces per deployment overwrites for the most
relevant pod fields like resources, affinities and processed
queues, number of jobs and the sidekiq security contexts.

The exact implementation was inspired by an upstream issue:

https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/issues/20453

* fix(chart): Remove linode default values from values

This patch drops the linode defaults from the values.yaml since
these are not obvious and can cause unexpected connections as
well as leaking secrets to linode, when other s3 storage
backends are used and don't explicitly configure these options
by accident.

Mastodon will then try to authenticate to the linode backends
and therefore disclose the authentication secrets.

* refactor(chart): Rework reduce value reference duplication

Since most of the values are simply setup like this:

```
{{- if .Values.someVariable }}
SOME_VARIABLE: {{ .Values.someVariable }}
{{- end }}
```

There is a lot of duplication in the references in order to
full in the variables. There is an equivalent notation, which
reduces the usage of the variable name to just once:

```
{{- with .Values.someVariable }}
SOME_VARIABLE: {{ . }}
{{- end }}
```

What seems like a pointless replacement, will reduce potential
mistakes down the line by possibly only adjusting one of the
two references.

* fix(chart): Switch to new OMNIAUTH_ONLY variable

This patch adjusts the helm chart to use the new `OMNIAUTH_ONLY`
variable, which replaced the former
`OAUTH_REDIRECT_AT_SIGN_IN` variable in the following commit:

https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/17288
https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/17288/commits/3c8857917ea9b9b3a76adb7afcea5842c8e1c0d1

* fix(chart): Repair connection test to existing service

Currently the connect test can't work, since it's connecting to
a non-existing service this patch fixes the service name to
make the job connect to the mastodon web service to verify the
connection.

* docs(chart): Adjust values.yaml to support helm-docs

This patch updates most values to prepare an introduction of
helm-docs. This should help to make the chart more user
friendly by explaining the variables and provide a standardised
README file, like many other helm charts do.

References:
https://github.com/norwoodj/helm-docs

* refactor(chart): Allow individual overwrites for streaming and web deployment

This patch works how the streaming and web deployments work by
adding various fields to overwrite values such as affinities,
resources, replica count, and security contexts.

BREAKING CHANGE: This commit removes `.Values.replicaCount` in
favour of `.Values.mastodon.web.replicas` and
`.Values.mastodon.streaming.values`.

* feat(chart): Add option for authorized fetch

Currently the helm chart doesn't support authorized fetch aka.
"Secure Mode" this patch fixes that by adding the needed config
option to the values file and the configmap.

* docs(chart): Improve helm-docs compatiblity

This patch adjust a few more comments in the values.yaml to be
picked up by helm-docs. This way, future adoption is properly
prepared.

* fix(chart): Add automatic detection of scheduler sidekiq queue

This patch adds an automatic switch to the `Recreate` strategy
for the sidekiq Pod in order to prevent accidental concurrency
for the scheduler queue.

* fix(chart): Repair broken DB_POOL variable

issue.title: Mastodon will highly delay fetching media on edited posts
issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Make a post on a remote instance
2. Fetch it on mastodon.social or any other Mastodon instance (or have it federated to you)
3. Edit the post on the remote instance, deleting the image and perhaps changing the image description
4. Fetch the post again (or have it federated to you)
...


### Expected behaviour

The image showing up

### Actual behaviour

The image is shown as a remote link, or as an empty image in apps as the media_proxy fails to fetch it for several attempts

### Detailed description

_No response_

### Specifications

51a33ce77a32b85eaff37670c40a497aaef13e18

comment.body: I originally intended to title this "will not fetch media on edited post" because it really takes a while. The instance was not busy with other processing either, and this happens consistently on edited posts.

issue.title: Custom Emojis: Enabled/Disabled filter
issue.body:
### Pitch

An additional filter, similar to how Federation has All/Limited and All/Failing/Unavailable, but for filtering through All/Enabled/Disabled emojis.

### Motivation

There are situations where instances might want to disable showing certain emojis. Having a filter to show just the emojis that are still enabled, just those that are disabled, and both would help with this task.

commits.message:
Don't allow URLs that contain non-normalized paths to be verified (#20999)

* Don't allow URLs that contain non-normalized paths to be verified

This stops things like https://example.com/otheruser/../realuser where
"/otheruser" appears to be the verified URL, but the actual URL being
verified is "/realuser" due to the "/../".

Also fix a test to use 'https', so it is testing the right thing, now
that since #20304 https is required.

* missing do

Fix not being able to follow more than one hashtag (#21285)

Fixes regression from #20860

Add missing procps package to Dockerfile (#21028)

The new Debian-Base does not come with this by default, making the ps based health-check in the compose file fail

Corrected issue Domain Blocks using the Email Domain Blocks message on ActionContoller::ParameterMissing
Corrected issue with Email Domain Blocks using the not_permitted string from "custom emojii's"

* Ran i18n-tasks normalize to address test failure

* Removed unused admin.export_domain_blocks.not_permitted string

Removing unused string as indicated by Check i18n

* Fix tests

(cherry picked from commit 9094c2f52c24e1c00b594e7c11cd00e4a07eb431)

* Fix domain block export not exporting blocks with only media rejection

(cherry picked from commit 26ff48ee48a5c03a2a4b0bd03fd322529e6bd960)

* Fix various issues with domain block import

- stop using Paperclip for processing domain allow/block imports
- stop leaving temporary files
- better error handling
- assume CSV files are UTF-8-encoded

(cherry picked from commit cad824d8f501b95377e4f0a957e5a00d517a1902)
